DOC.brief_summary: Ionizing radiation has cytotoxic effects, and is commonly used as treatment for neoplasm. A common adverse effect of radiation is acute diarrhoea. Glutamine is an aminoacid with antioxidant effects that can protect tissues of damage dued to radiation. The investigators designed a randomized, double-blind trial phase III to study if glutamine prevents acute radiation enteritis.
DOC.brief_title: Prevention of Acute Radiation Enteritis With Glutamine
DOC.criteria: Age > 18 yr Gynaecological,prostatic, rectal or other abdominal cancer Radiotherapy with/without chemotherapy life expectancy < 1 yr Age < 18 yr gut diseases: inflammatory bowel disease,sprue, irritable bowel disease... moderate to severe chronic renal failure hepatic cirrhosis
